isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE FAN CONTROL - SIGNAL FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The purpose of the Engine Fan Control is to provide On/Off control of the engine cooling system fan for the engine and to provide a load for vehicle retarding when required. The strategy in the ECM that controls the Engine Fan solenoid monitors engine coolant temperature, intake air temperature, engine mode selection (engine in an operating mode or diagnostic mode) and the programmable limits and settings programmed in the ECM. (Accessible with the EST tool). Engine Fan Control can be either programmed:

item.para: Coolant temperature activation and Retarder Operation
